meanings.definition: Belief in the superiority of a particular race.
meanings.sent1: Her racialism led her to think her race was better than others.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the harmful effects of racialism in society.
meanings.sent3: His extreme racialism made him believe his race had superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The roots of racialism run deep in our history, affecting many generations.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of racialism can be devastating, causing division and conflict.

meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice based on race.
meanings.sent1: Racialism can lead to unfair treatment and inequality.
meanings.sent2: The company has strict policies against any form of racialism.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the absurdity of racialism.
meanings.sent4: In a world without racialism, diversity would be celebrated without bias.
meanings.sent5: The fight against racialism requires unity and understanding among all races.
